intro: Eriocaulon hondoense var. gracile, commonly known as the Hondo slender sedge, is a flowering plant species native to Japan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
